title: 106_s243
content:
The Act titled "Perkins County Rural Water System Act of 1999" recognizes the Perkins County Rural Water System as part of the Southwest Pipeline Project, authorized by the North Dakota State Legislature and the Garrison Diversion Unit Reformulation Act of 1986. The Perkins County Rural Water System Act of 1999 defines key terms such as Corporation, Feasibility study, Project construction budget, and Pumping and incidental operational requirements. The term "pumping and incidental operational requirements" refers to power needs related to operating the water supply system. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior. The term "water supply system" includes intake facilities, pumping stations, water treatment facilities, cooling facilities, reservoirs, and pipelines operated by the Perkins County Rural Water System, Inc. Federal assistance is provided for water supply systems. The Secretary will provide grants to the Corporation for the planning, construction, and repairs of water supply systems to ensure conservation of resources. Construction funds will only be available after meeting environmental requirements and submitting an engineering report and water conservation plan to Congress. Mitigation of fish and wildlife losses from the water supply system construction will be based on ecological equivalency, concurrent with project construction. Use of Pick-Sloan power is authorized. The Western Area Power Administration will provide capacity and energy for irrigation and drainage pumping for the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin Program from May 1 to October 31 each year. The Corporation must operate on a not-for-profit basis and may purchase electric service from a qualified preference power supplier. The Western Area Power Administration will provide capacity and energy for irrigation and drainage pumping for the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin Program. The Corporation must operate on a not-for-profit basis and may purchase power from a qualified preference power supplier. The rate schedule for the power made available shall be the firm power rate schedule of the Pick-Sloan Eastern Division in effect at the time of delivery. A contract must be agreed upon by the Western Area Power Administration, the power supplier, the entity's power supplier, and the Corporation to pass through the benefit of the rate schedule. The power supplier of the Corporation can pass charges to the water system for electric service, including usual charges. SEC. 7. FEDERAL SHARE: 75% of project budget for water supply system under section 4. SEC. 8. NON-FEDERAL SHARE: 25% of project budget for water supply system under section 4. SEC. 9. CONSTRUCTION OVERSIGHT. SEC. 9. CONSTRUCTION OVERSIGHT.

The Secretary may assist the Corporation in overseeing construction of the water supply system. Funds for planning and construction may not exceed 3% of the total project budget for the portion in Perkins County, South Dakota.

SEC. 10. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

$15,000,000 is authorized for planning and construction of the water supply system. Additional funds may be appropriated for development cost increases after March 1, 1995. Passed the Senate March 25, 1999.
